page.title: 06Memories of Winnall
page.content: When we went to interview Mrs. Dawson, she told us that where she lives in St.John's Road,trains used to come under her house through the tunnel. The trains do not come under her house any more but the tunnel is still there now.They use the tunnel for a shooting range .Mrs. Dawson said that where houses are now were fields. There are still some fields now but they are used for allotments. Mrs Dawson used to work for 20 years in a shop called"The Handy Shop".It is still there now.Near the"Handy Shop" were cottages but now there is a police station and where there were some more cottages is the School of Art. Mrs Dawson said that they had to dig 10 metres down to build the School of Art and it was all under water as there is a river near by.
